org.ojalgo.random.process

Class GaussianField<K extends Comparable<K>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ojalgo.random.process.GaussianField<K>

  • public final class GaussianField<K extends Comparable<K>>
extends Object
    A Gaussian process is a stochastic process whose realizations consist of random values associated with every point in a range of times (or of space) such that each such random variable has a normal distribution. Moreover, every finite collection of those random variables has a multivariate normal distribution. A random field is a generalization of a stochastic process such that the underlying parameter need no longer be a simple real or integer valued "time", but can instead take values that are multidimensional vectors, or points on some manifold. This GaussianField class is a generalization, as well as the underlying implementation, of GaussianProcess. Prior to calling #getDistribution(boolean, double) you must call #addObservation(double, double) one or more times.
    Author:
    apete
